thread.title: Origin raises $1.35bn through institutional offer
thread.title_full: Origin raises $1.35bn through institutional offer | Business Spectator

author: Amber Plum
title: Origin raises $1.35bn through institutional offer
text:
Origin Energy has won strong support from institutional investors for its capital raising program, securing $1.35 billion in the first round of its offer.
Around 92 per cent of eligible institutional holders took up the $4.00 per share entitlement, with the shortfall bought under a smaller bookbuild which priced shares at $5.20 apiece, representing a $1.20 premium.
The energy retailer will use proceeds to pay down debt, as tough trading conditions threaten its balance sheet.
“The success of the institutional component of the capital raising demonstrates strong support for the suite of capital initiatives announced by Origin to restore balance sheet strength and maintain an investment grade credit rating,” Managing Director Grant King said.
Origin plans to raise the remaining $1.2bn of its $2.5bn raising target through a four-for-seven retail offer opening on October 13.
Shares will be offered to retail investors at $4.00.
The group revealed plans earlier this week to reduce capex and working capital requirements $1bn across the current and following years, amid a broad push to strengthen its balance sheet.
It has also flagged dividend reductions to around 20c in fiscal 2016 and 2017, and the sale of up to $800 million of non-core assets.
